intro: Gnaphalium subglomeratum, commonly known as the clustered groundsel, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and marshes. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are surrounded by pale green bracts. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
